heading: crash course
subheading: solemn mourners from oakland to new york marked the 100th anniversary of the death of henry bliss on monday. in 1899, bliss got knocked down by a car, becoming the first of about 3 million americans killed in automobile accidents. organizers of a "national day of mourning" wanted motorists to shut off their engines at 5 p.m. for a silent vigil. reports from around the country indicated many vehicles were at a standstill. but their engines -- and horns -- were far from silent.
author: wired staff
text: solemn mourners from oakland to new york marked the 100th anniversary of the death of henry bliss on monday. in 1899, bliss got knocked down by a car, becoming the first of about 3 million americans killed in automobile accidents. organizers of a "national day of mourning" wanted motorists to shut off their engines at 5 p.m. for a silent vigil. reports from around the country indicated many vehicles were at a standstill. but their engines -- and horns -- were far from silent.
